body: In its yearly report Committee to Protect Journalists (CPJ) analyzes situation with Post-Soviet online expression, noting that online censorship in the region has become more subtle without losing efficiency. "Accidents befall Web servers, just as mysterious, unsolved crimes of violence silence the region's online journalists."
original_body: In its yearly report Committee to Protect Journalists (CPJ) analyzes situation with Post-Soviet online expression, noting that online censorship in the region has become more subtle without losing efficiency. "Accidents befall Web servers, just as mysterious, unsolved crimes of violence silence the region's online journalists."
title: Russia: Old and New Media Censorship Tactics
